Compute Standard deviations of CoP displacements

Source: vignettes/SD_CoP_ComputeR.Rmd
SD_CoP_ComputeR.Rmd
library(BalanceMate)

Introduction

From a broad perspective, two types of postural indicators can be computed from the BalanceMate package:

  • Indicators that measure average displacements (i.e., CoP-X and CoP-Y)
  • Indicators that measure variability in displacements (e.g., Sway Path Length)

Whereas the former family is useful for researchers interested in motivation (approach, and avoidance), the latter is of interest for researchers assessing loss of stability through substance use, or freezing behaviours when facing threat (among other examples).

The SD_CoP_ComputeR command will compute standard deviations of CoP-X and SD CoP-Y at a pre-specified time bin level (or at a participant level) from a list of CoP.

Example Usage

You collected the data of 6 participants who viewed passively pictures for 100 seconds with a sample rate if 100Hz. You are interested in the standard deviations of CoP-Y and CoP-X displacements during the first half of the session (pleasant pictures) and the last half of the sessions (unpleasant pictures).

Note: the files are stored as Rdata to reduce the size of the package – however the command only accepts txt files, hence it is required to first convert Rdata to text files before running the examples

# 1. Locate the installed extdata/ folder (contains only .RData now)
path_extdata <- system.file("extdata", package = "BalanceMate")

# 2. Find all .RData (case‐insensitive)
rdata_files <- list.files(
  path_extdata,
  pattern    = "\\.[Rr][Dd]ata$",
  full.names = TRUE
)

# 3. Convert each .RData to a .txt in a temp directory
tmpdir <- tempdir()
for (f in rdata_files) {
  load(f)  # e.g. loads object “Postural_DataA” into your session
  nm <- tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))
  write.table(
    get(nm),
    file      = file.path(tmpdir, paste0(nm, ".txt")),
    sep       = ",",
    row.names = FALSE,
    col.names = FALSE,
    quote     = FALSE
  )
}


# 4. Merge from the tempdir
Data <- Merge_PosData(
  directory_path = tmpdir,              
  SampleRate     = 100,
  SessionDuration= 100
)


BalanceMate::SD_CoP_ComputeR(data = Data, CoPX_col = "CoP_X", CoPY_col = "CoP_Y", ID = "file_name", time_col = "Time", epoch_length = 50)
#>                      participant_id epoch   SD_CoPX   SD_CoPY
#> Postural_DataA.txt.1 Postural_DataA     1 0.7268099 1.6055507
#> Postural_DataA.txt.2 Postural_DataA     2 0.6423907 1.1016563
#> Postural_DataB.txt.1 Postural_DataB     1 0.4058029 0.9347083
#> Postural_DataB.txt.2 Postural_DataB     2 1.2070619 1.6830840
#> Postural_DataC.txt.1 Postural_DataC     1 1.4272926 1.1220119
#> Postural_DataC.txt.2 Postural_DataC     2 0.7831269 1.8463917
#> Postural_DataD.txt.1 Postural_DataD     1 0.1590094 0.3148304
#> Postural_DataD.txt.2 Postural_DataD     2 0.1310441 0.2998770
#> Postural_DataE.txt.1 Postural_DataE     1 0.1510369 0.3389700
#> Postural_DataE.txt.2 Postural_DataE     2 0.2844142 0.4364505
#> Postural_DataF.txt.1 Postural_DataF     1 0.1947909 0.2864728
#> Postural_DataF.txt.2 Postural_DataF     2 0.1690412 0.3838904

Note: the Merge_PosData automatically computes CoP for each data points, as well as the Time course for each session.
